style.blurb: Montepulciano-only red DOC wine from Central Italy
style.description:
The grape Montepulciano can be grown in most of Italy, but the biggest region for it is Abruzzo. The region produces wine in two main styles—one soft and approachable, the other rich and more tannic.

Montepulciano d'Abruzzo is a good region for good value, but often the wines are not quite as great as they could be.

There is really only one fine wine in Abruzzo and it is Montepulciano d'Abruzzo. At its best, the grape Montepulciano can produce wines that are dry, rich, powerful, and dark in color. However, often the quality is a little low and it can be uninteresting.

This wine can be pretty similar to Chianti in style. This is not surprising given that it can have up to 15% Sangiovese in it. Blending with Sangiovese adds body and complexity with flavor ranging from fruity to Savory. ines.

There is often an aroma common to wines from Montepulciano d'Abruzzo that can be described as “animal”. It can be very seductive in small amounts, but can be pretty terrible if strong.
interesting_facts: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo can contain up to 15% Sangiovese.
Vino di Nobile Montepulciano is made in the town of Montepulciano, but not from the Montepulciano grape!
In 2003, Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane was promoted to DOCG status.
Abruzzo is a very mountainous region.

wine.description:
It has intense ruby red colour with violet nuances; intense, characteristic bouquet of the primary
grape aromas; fruity component, full-bodied and robust, well-balanced with tannin and oak features.

How could I forget to review this old Classic housewine! It always delivers👌
Chocolate, Gooseberry, raspberry, oak, vanilla, cherry and plum! An orchestra of flavors and due to its low price it is a winner!
Great wine to cheese, bbq or on its own.... maybe with some nice chocolate!

reviews.note:
Appearance is medium purple, opaque with thin legs that quickly form.  

Nose is initially a pleasant violet flower, then come aromas of blueberry, menthol, cherry cough syrup and cocoa.  

Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium high acidity and low tannin structure.  

Flavors of bing cherry, cranberry, blueberry, and some faint leather and vanilla notes.

reviews.note:
Delicious chewy red! Medium ruby color. Gorgeous nose full of red fruit like red plums, smashed raspberries and cherry. I also get baking spices like cinnamon and some caramel with like a smoky resin. A bit of cocoa and sweet mint too!  
Medium plus body, medium plus alcohol, medium acid, medium alcohol, dry. 
Tastes of vanilla, sweet plum, blackberries, tobacco ash, boysenberry and guava.

reviews.note:
Rounding up to 4 stars as this is an inexpensive crowd pleaser, that is easy drinking by itself and easily paired with the diverse array of appetizers at our get together.

Medium bodied with bright acidity providing zip to the mid palate. Dark fruit on the nose with fruit forward flavors of blackberries, plums, and blueberries along with mocha, black peppers, potting soil, and hint of smoke.  Mild tannins with integrated oak in an earthy finish.

Delicious chewy red! Medium ruby color. Gorgeous nose full of red fruit like red plums, smashed raspberries and cherry. I also get baking spices like cinnamon and some caramel with like a smoky resin. A bit of cocoa and sweet mint too!  
Medium plus body, medium plus alcohol, medium acid, medium alcohol, dry. 
Tastes of vanilla, sweet plum, blackberries, tobacco ash, boysenberry and guava.

reviews.note:
🍷 deep ruby. Let it decant for 45 min to an hour.

Le bouquet: a pinch of tobacco and potting soil.

La langue: dark cherries, red plum, prune, cranberry, dark chocolate, oak, tobacco and lovely taste of graphite. I love those earthy notes in wines. It makes me feel closer to the actual location.

Nice structure with medium acidity & medium tannins. It finishes well with licorice at the end like the previous years. Medium body.

Delicious with mild sausages or hen.

reviews.note:
Enjoying a nice afternoon vino with friend and fellow vivino Stephen Jackson.

Wine #1:
Very nice bottle - deep garnet in the glass.  Medium body, sour, long finish.  Oaky and earthy aroma: cloves, cocoa and fresh asphalt. Full and balanced palate: black plum, prune, sour cherry, liquorice, pepper.  Well enjoyed.

Wine #1:
Very nice bottle - deep garnet in the glass.  Medium body, sour, long finish.  Oaky and earthy aroma: cloves, cocoa and fresh asphalt. Full and balanced palate: black plum, prune, sour cherry, liquorice, pepper.  Well enjoyed.

reviews.note: This is a quality wine that won't bust the budget. Very pretty, translucent, deep Garnet color with a plum rim. On the nose is some toasted bread, eucalyptus, cedar shavings, graphite and menthol. Very pleasant. The flavors or fruit forward; blackberry, dark cherry, and plums over some earthy note - leather and black tea. It's a bit on the sweet side. Medium silky tannins. Long warming finish with a touch of oak. Long, long legs. Really 3.8/5.

reviews.note:
Deep purple color in the glass. 🍷

Smells mellow with a little acidity and a hint of potting soil.

The dominants are prune, cranberry and red plum on the palate, a note of blueberry, and a gentle earthy note of graphite. 

The acidity settles nicely at the end of the sip for a few seconds with a lingering taste of black licorice. 

I reviewed the 2016,last year, but this one may be a little better. Black licorice is a common trait.

I really enjoyed this Montepulciano d’Abruzzo and would have it again!

reviews.note:
Very nice Montepulciano d'Abruzzo, 
a medium red-ruby color
with dark red reflexes. 
Nose: dark red and black fruit, green herbs, leather, earthy notes, smoked barrels. 
In the mouth: plums, red cherries, mulberries, fresh cranberries, intense spices, chilli, dried ginger, pepper, fresh herbs, tobacco, oak barrel, smoked nuances.
Wine medium to full body, nice ripe acidity, and pleasant, though feisty tannins balanced with fruity acidity. 
Finish long, slightly tart 
with mineral, earthy aftertaste.

reviews.note:
Rounding up to 4 stars as this is an inexpensive crowd pleaser, that is easy drinking by itself and easily paired with the diverse array of appetizers at our get together.

Medium bodied with bright acidity providing zip to the mid palate. Dark fruit on the nose with fruit forward flavors of blackberries, plums, and blueberries along with mocha, black peppers, potting soil, and hint of smoke.  Mild tannins with integrated oak in an earthy finish.

reviews.note: Lovely for a bargain price of $12 at Costco. Big fruit and spice upfront with some leather and meaty character. Slight Earth tobacco. Palate is embraced by med+ acidity and med tannins. Full flavored with a long cherry finish that Is sweet and mouthwatering. Nice savory herb nuances in the retrohale. Very syrah-like imo.

reviews.note: Such a solid montepulciano. Robust black fruit, a smooth but earthy taste following. Well balanced and bold. Goes well with pizza, pasta, and (unashamedly) peanut butter and jelly. Worth a buy.

reviews.note: A nice compex wine that is accelerated to the next level when combined with pasts, in this case pasta pecorino. Low-med acidity and low tannins, which helps to cut through the parmesan and butter nicely. Pinch of salt adds flavour to it. Aroma and smell in general not very strong, but light and present. Smell of dark cherries, green pepper and hints of almonds (also maybe violet, couldn't figure that out). Aroma of dark cherry, almond, and hints of green pepper and plun. Will need air and Room temperature.

As usual awesome offering for under $15. This puppy can run with the big dogs 🐕 🐶.

reviews.note: Super interesting red. There was almost no detectable nose. I tried throughout the evenjng and it was just absent. But the palate was somehow wonderful - rich fruit compote with brown sugar undertone. Not cloyingly sweet, but on the sweeter side. The finish was bone dry and tannic. So it was just an odd bird so to speak. But a pleasant one that went well with a light creamy salmon and pasta dish. I’d order this again.

reviews.note: 4 stars because it's a very good wine for the price. Nose is blackberries, mouth is balanced, dry, yet full bodied. Mouth is ripe black fruit, dried figs with a slightly spicy finish. Drink with osso bucco or other meat cooked in a broth, or try it with aged cheeses.

reviews.note:
3.6 one of the many bonus wines of out DOC(G) themed Vivino meet up in Vernon. I was blasted last night when it opened. Luckily it was ripe and full of texture. 

Kernel, molasses, dark fruit, licorice spices and even a hint of grapey flavour. Gritty tannin like sediment in coffee. Very long finish of tertiary flavours. Juicy, full bodied, but not too much depth. Nice persistence of flavour. Finishes like hot cocoa. 

Easy drinking, simple, wouldn't attempt further aging

reviews.note: A nice medium to dark ruby wine that went well with prosciutto and chicken tortelloni in a red sauce. 2 hour decant. Scents of cherry, boysenberry and strawberry with dried herbs and oak. Taste was sour cherry, boysenberry and myrtle berry followed by oregano and rosemary with a acidic tar and juniper finish. Like most Italian reds a very highly acidic wine that goes well with a tomato- based red sauce.

reviews.note:
Aka the "Stick Wine" due to the fancy stick on there label. 

Description: intense violet robe. Aromas of plum & ripe blackberry. Each sip deliveries a mouthful of ripe berries, leather, & black pepper with subtle hints of oregano, dried herbs & a touch of vanilla; all leading to a dry & supple finish. 

Great & satisfying wine with a excellent price point. If you have never tried a Montepulciano  before this is a great starter. 

Cheers!

reviews.note: This vintage has aged particularly well. I had intentionally held this in cellar for several years, and it was worth the wait. Cinnamon and smoke over slate and blackberry nose. Dark garnet color. Full palate experience with forward blackberry, middle black pepper, and moderate tannins in the finish. Accompanied by hand made pizza, an excellent match. (2017)

reviews.note:
Interesting aromas of aging floral,  eucalyptus, meaty notes and fainting mint...cherry fruit, red berry jam...smashed raisins.
Climbing acidity gives way to a very smooth palate painting. Noticeable meaty notes and dried fruit set the stage. Balanced. Polished tannins hold it together...from tongue tip to exit. Finishes dry but with lengthy fruit and oak.  This delivers nice satisfaction at a good QPR of $14.00👍
Mar 2018 - 91 points

reviews.note: Fresh fruity flavour, juicy blackberries and blueberries notes supported by underlying acidity. Black licorice, balsamic dark chocolate herbs and white pepper . All this in a medium body and relatively soft tannis wine. One of the most incredible value for money. Bought online for around 7€.

reviews.note: So Montepulciano isn’t a trendy wine right now, which is why you need to get in before folks realize what a delight it is. Low tannin, lots of fruit, great with pizza and wings, cheesy snacks, or a big pasta dinner. Also really excellent for sipping without food. It’s the lager beer of red wine. This is probably the most well-known vineyard and it is quite good to intro your friends to this wine.

How could I forget to review this old Classic housewine! It always delivers👌
Chocolate, Gooseberry, raspberry, oak, vanilla, cherry and plum! An orchestra of flavors and due to its low price it is a winner!
Great wine to cheese, bbq or on its own.... maybe with some nice chocolate!

reviews.note: Fantastic Montepulzziano d'Abruzzo from Cantina Zaccagnini. First of all dark red colour with intriquing violet reflexes, it looks like  wine is dense and oily. After some decanting wine reveals intense and rich aroma  of ripe cherries, plums, red berries with leather hints and perceptible barrel with  herbs.  In mouth different berries, smoked plums, some sweets. Medium to full body, not excessively tannic, delicate acidity. Well balanced. Excellent ambassador of good winery. Highly recommend.

reviews.note: This is a quality wine that won't bust the budget. Very pretty, translucent, deep Garnet color with a plum rim. On the nose is some toasted bread, eucalyptus, cedar shavings, graphite and menthol. Very pleasant. The flavors or fruit forward; blackberry, dark cherry, and plums over some earthy note - leather and black tea. It's a bit on the sweet side. Medium silky tannins. Long warming finish with a touch of oak. Long, long legs. Really 3.8/5.

reviews.note:
🍷 deep ruby. Let it decant for 45 min to an hour.

Le bouquet: a pinch of tobacco and potting soil.

La langue: dark cherries, red plum, prune, cranberry, dark chocolate, oak, tobacco and lovely taste of graphite. I love those earthy notes in wines. It makes me feel closer to the actual location.

Nice structure with medium acidity & medium tannins. It finishes well with licorice at the end like the previous years. Medium body.

Delicious with mild sausages or hen.

reviews.note:
3.8/5 Dark beet red, sugarcane cork. Cloudy translucence. Soapy bubbles, medium-light body, abundant thin legs. Aerated and decanted 45min.

Juicy cherry, grapey undertone, paprika chilies, vanilla and leatherette nose.

Full-on dry palate. Dehydrated cherry, raisin, musky paprika, old strawberries and dried vanilla bean releases midway to black tea and clean charcoal ash tannins.

Fruited psuedo finish resurges green. Chewy long aftertaste.

Pairing: Chocolate brownies 😁

reviews.note: Surprisingly complex and full of taste. Surprising since the price is a bargain. I am amazed. This gorgeous bottle of vino from the Abruzzo region in central Italy is full of plum, leather and vanilla. It is fairly acidic, in a balanced way. A splash of citrus. Goes well with  almost any Italian dish. We have enjoyed it with pasta, pizza and stand alone. Go get a couple of bottles and enjoy. Cin cin 🇮🇹🍇👌⭐️😀

wine.name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo (Il Vino dal Tralcetto Riserva)

reviews.tagged_note: Surprisingly complex and full of taste. Surprising since the price is a bargain. I am amazed. This gorgeous bottle of vino from the Abruzzo region in central Italy is full of plum, leather and vanilla. It is fairly acidic, in a balanced way. A splash of citrus. Goes well with  almost any Italian dish. We have enjoyed it with pasta, pizza and stand alone. Go get a couple of bottles and enjoy. Cin cin 🇮🇹🍇👌⭐️😀

reviews.note: 3.8  Purple with pink rim. Red and blue fruit, and orange rind on the nose. Dry, m+ body, m+ acidity, 13% ABV, m tannins, long thick legs, long finish. Raspberries, blackberries, dark cherries,  orange rind, dark chocolate, tannins, and black pepper on the palate. Finishes with lingering fruit, firm tannins, and a bit of black pepper. Should get better with aging. Great QPR. Paired with homemade Fettucine with red meat sauce.

reviews.note:
Robust aromas of stewed plum, allspice and crabapple compote. 

Round mouthfeel of dark cherry, anise, black olive tapenade and black pepper. 

Dry and tannic, gritty and dusty palate and hint of persimmon. 

Highly quaffable Montepulciano D’Abruzzo. Beviamo insieme amici!  Cin cin.

reviews.note:
Delicious chewy red! Medium ruby color. Gorgeous nose full of red fruit like red plums, smashed raspberries and cherry. I also get baking spices like cinnamon and some caramel with like a smoky resin. A bit of cocoa and sweet mint too!  
Medium plus body, medium plus alcohol, medium acid, medium alcohol, dry. 
Tastes of vanilla, sweet plum, blackberries, tobacco ash, boysenberry and guava.

reviews.note:
I must start decanting.

This wine was a little hot upon opening, but it smelled so wonderful I could only let it open for a couple minutes. 

Garnet with magenta edges. Aromas of blackberry jam, red chile, dark earth, and bright ripe red berries. Flavors of red berries, red pepper, and a touch of dirt. Racy acidity leaning towards astringent on first opening. Tingles the tastebuds like when you eat too much pineapple. Juicy tannins, finishes with spicy pepper

reviews.note: Just not my taste in wines.  Too acidic, too peppery, too dry.  It’s exactly as described by the profile of wines from this region and our goal is simply to rate what we like and don’t like.  Our low score shouldn’t be reflective of the quality.  It was reasonably well-balanced and paired well with elements of my Italian Mother’s Day dinner, but while only medium bodied I wouldn’t call it easy drinking for me anyway

The fruit fades quickly and is replaced by pepper notes and tannic dryness.  Hint of sweetness.  Blackberry, but not fresh.  Very sour.  Abv 13 is low compared to what it tastes like.  Out of balance.

reviews.note:
Ok... the piece of “wood “ on the bottle is a clipping from the vineyard. In case anyone was wondering.

Moderate density and acidity with softer tannins and acidity.  Ruby color and fair residual sugars.  Cherry, raspberry and oak, dried flowers and dust across a soft, slightly dry texture.  Moderate flavors at first but they fade into a singular, simple finish.  Decent blend that paired nicely with a cheese board and Sicilian herbed olives.

Moderate flavors at first but they fade into a singular, simple finish.  Decent blend that paired nicely with a cheese board and Sicilian herbed olives.

reviews.note:
A medium weight with juicy cherry and plum coming through in the mouth, smooth and dusky supporting tannins, firming acidity and even deeper black cherry flavours appearing on the finish.
If you don’t want an absolutely full-bodied red with your meal, but still want something that will hold it’s own - here you are!

vintage.name: Cantina Zaccagnini Montepulciano d'Abruzzo (Il Vino dal Tralcetto Riserva) 2016

wine.name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo (Il Vino dal Tralcetto Riserva)

reviews.tagged_note: Great taste, love it

reviews.note: My go-to red. Deep blood red (hints of purple). Aroma is animal, complex and seductive. Red berries, cherry, plum, and sharp parmesan cheese on the nose. Full bodied and dry. Black pepper, tart stone fruit, and strawberries make up the palate. Oaky finish. High tannins. A gorgeous Montepulciano D’Abruzzo and great value for the price. Pairs well with red meat, lamb, sharp cheese and spicy entrees.

Black pepper, tart stone fruit, and strawberries make up the palate. Oaky finish. High tannins. A gorgeous Montepulciano D’Abruzzo and great value for the price. reviews.note: Excellent wine at a great price point. Old world basic Italian elegance. Solid taste on the palate, rich tannins and wonderful mouthfeel. This is a simple and delicious Italian red montepulciano to be savored. Actually pairs well with a pizza. Try this one, at the price point it’s exceptional.
